It was supposed to be a project funded by the city council;  it was supposed to benefit those Fargo-Moorehead children who would otherwise not be able to afford to attend a lakeshore summer camp.  But nobody consulted city controller Stu Jacobson...

It is late evening, blowing storm.  A leisurely pan across the bleak gray expanse finds a little hut in the middle of the frozen lake with a pickup truck parked next to it.
The top, open, level.  Snow blows.  A car sits idling.
Carl screams down the ramp.  He takes a corner at high speed and swerves, just missing Jerry in his Olds on his way to the top.
Jerry pulls to a halt next to Wade's idling Cadillac.  He gets out and walks slowly to Wade's body, prostrate in the swirling snow.
Carl's car roars into frame, violently swirling the snow.
